content.description: To the right of Rim of the World - best access is by doing stem/chimney move near 'Point of Entry' to continue right along wall. Use this route to access 'Top of the world'
content.protection: bolts to a 2-bolt anchor with rappel chains

content.description: Start below the fixed pin (good to clip a 24" runner) and climb the lower face past two bolts.  Clip the first bolt on the upper headwall and pull the roof move.  Continue up past two more bolts to a two-bolt anchor.
content.location: Located on the center of the formation. Third bolted line from the left. FA named this 'Vader'.

content.description: good fluid movements till the crux on the last bolt
content.protection: bolts, 2 bolt anchor with rappel chains
content.location: To access this route you must climb Underworld and then walk past the anchors 30 feet

content.description:
Climbs up a fin that is to the right of Exit Strategy. This is the second route if climbing the Storm Trooper Circuit.

This route was done by Jay in January 2014 when the Rim of the World climbing club made their first visit to Fairview Mountain.
content.location: 40 feet to the right of the Vader wall on a slender fin.

content.description: Crux is near bolt 3 maybe. This route is the first route in the Storm Trooper Circuit. After climbing this route lower down and right to access the belay for exit strategy, rim of the world, and Underworld.
content.protection: Bolts and bolted anchor. Shares anchor with Exit Strategy.
content.location: 20 feet to the right of Crack in the Armor. This climbs up a smaller formation on the right side of the Vader Roof.

content.description: Starts 5 feet right of Must Face Vader. Hard boulder move pulling past the roof.
content.protection: 6 bolts. Shares bolted anchor with Must Face Vader.
content.location: 5 feet right of Must Face Vader.

climbs.name: Invader
climbs.fa: Reed Ames, Kim Dang, Morgan Thompson

content.description:
Head up the crack that is to the left of

You Must Face Vader

and traverse right under the roof and start clipping bolts to the top.  Same roof pulling crux as the original line.
content.protection: Single rack to 3" and some draws for the bolts above the roof.
content.location: On the left side of Vader Roof. Look for the crack in the corner.

content.description: This route is best accessed by lower off the anchor to the right after climbing point of Entry. This is the last route to be climbed if doing the Storm Trooper Circuit.
content.protection: Bolts and bolted anchor. Shares anchor with Point of Entry.
content.location: Starts 20 feet to the right of Point of Entry.

content.description: This route is on the far left side of the Vader wall. Crux is on the lower half. Climb up the steep lower section to a low angle ledge and continue up the left arete until the anchor.
content.location: Far left side of the Vader wall.

content.description: On the right side of the Vader roof wall. Follow a low angle buttress up and right, then move back left underneath the roof and wedge your body in the wide crack. A few more odd moves and you'll find yourself above the roof, cruising to the anchor.
content.location: Right side of the Vader wall.
